critique: This executive order focuses on increasing access to and affordability of childcare and long-term care. It directs various agencies to explore ways to improve compensation and job quality for care workers, make care more accessible and affordable for families, and expand care options. The order emphasizes support for family caregivers and aims to build the capacity of local communities to deliver care. It also encourages engagement with various stakeholders, including parents, care providers, and labor unions. The order does not touch on immigration, national security, or federalism in any significant way. It leans liberal in its focus on social welfare and government intervention in the care market. It also promotes diversity and inclusion by addressing the needs of women and people of color in the care workforce.
